title: Domain 4.1: Summarize cloud computing concepts.
content:
☁️ Common Cloud Models (Deployment Models)

Private Cloud

Owned/operated by one organization, on-prem or offsite. Offers full control and security.

🧠 Used by banks, governments, healthcare.

Public Cloud

Owned by third-party providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Cost-effective, scalable.

🧠 Ideal for startups, public-facing sites, non-sensitive data.

Hybrid Cloud

Combination of private + public. Sensitive data in private, apps in public cloud.

🧠 Common with e-commerce platforms.

Community Cloud

Shared by orgs with common goals (e.g., education, healthcare research).

🧠 Rare but testable – think shared gov/edu cloud.

💻 Cloud Service Models (Delivery Models)

  • IaaS: Infrastructure – you manage OS/apps (e.g., AWS EC2)
  • SaaS: Software – fully managed (e.g., Google Workspace)
  • PaaS: Platform – for app development/deployment (e.g., Heroku)

🧠 Tip: Install = IaaS | Develop = PaaS | Use = SaaS

🌩️ Cloud Characteristics

  • Shared Resources: Virtualized/shared infrastructure
  • Metered Utilization: Pay only for usage
  • Rapid Elasticity: Scale up/down instantly
  • High Availability: Always-on design with redundancy
  • File Sync: Sync files across devices (e.g., OneDrive)

🖥️ Desktop Virtualization

Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) – On-Prem

Hosted in-house, secure, full control. Requires IT maintenance.

🧠 Best for compliance-focused companies.

VDI in the Cloud

Cloud-hosted desktops, accessible from anywhere. Scalable, low maintenance.

🧠 Ideal for remote workers and dynamic teams.
